items.description:
Happy Friday,

Well actually we are a little late this week, so happy Saturday ;-) This week we have a bunch of videos for you to go through, including the excellent sessions at XamExpertDay. But there is so much more too!

As always, thanks to the community for their excellent posts and have a wonderful, safe weekend.

❤

Kym

items.title: 4 Ways To Communicate the Visibility of System Status in UI
items.description:
Visibility of system status is one of Jakob Nielsen’s ten heuristics for user interface design. By communicating the current state of the system, you make users feel in control with the system, and this sense of control helps you build trust.

4 Ways To Communicate the Visibility of System Status in UI by Nick Babich
items.description_markdown:
Visibility of system status is one of Jakob Nielsen’s ten heuristics for user interface design. By communicating the current state of the system, you make users feel in control with the system, and this sense of control helps you build trust.

[**4 Ways To Communicate the Visibility of System Status in UI**](https://uxplanet.org/4-ways-to-communicate-the-visibility-of-system-status-in-ui-14ff2351c8e8) by [Nick Babich](https://uxplanet.org/@101)

embedded_links.title: **4 Ways To Communicate the Visibility of System Status in UI**

items.title: The How (and Why) of User Flows
items.description:
User Flows show the path a user takes through an app as they complete a specific task. The ability to create and think in user flows is one of the most important skills in a designing an app.

The How (and Why) of User Flows by Jordan Bowman
items.description_markdown:
User Flows show the path a user takes through an app as they complete a specific task. The ability to create and think in user flows is one of the most important skills in a designing an app.

[**The How (and Why) of User Flows**](https://www.learnuxd.io/posts/the-how-and-why-of-user-flows/) by [Jordan Bowman](https://twitter.com/jrdnbwmn)

items.title: Join Hacktoberfest at the Xamarin Community Toolkit
items.description:
You may have heard about the Xamarin Community Toolkit by now. This toolkit will be an important part of the Xamarin.Forms ecosystem during the evolution to .NET 6. Now is the time to contribute since it is “Hacktoberfest” after all!

items.title: How to provide negative numeric input on Xamarin.Forms iOS
items.description: When creating a text input in Xamarin.Forms you might want to show a numeric keyboard. However, when setting it up and running your app on iOS you can’t put in negative numbers. What’s up with that? How to provide negative numeric input on Xamarin.Forms iOS by Steven Thewissen
items.description_markdown:
When creating a text input in Xamarin.Forms you might want to show a numeric keyboard. However, when setting it up and running your app on iOS you can’t put in negative numbers. What’s up with that?
[**How to provide negative numeric input on Xamarin.Forms iOS**](https://www.thewissen.io/how-to-provide-negative-numeric-input-on-xamarin-forms-ios/) by [Steven Thewissen](https://twitter.com/devnl)

embedded_links.title: **How to provide negative numeric input on Xamarin.Forms iOS**

items.title: Mobile App Redesign For Developers Star Tracker OnBoarding Empty States Part 1
items.description:
In this talk, you will learn how to integrate our Star Tracker UI designs on the GitTrends Project leveraging C# for markup guided by our special guest and speaker Brandon Minnick, we are then going to cover our last topics for our live series Onboarding & Empty states with the help of our Speaker Luis Pujols.

Mobile App Redesign For Developers Star Tracker OnBoarding Empty States Part 1 by dotnetdo

items.title: October of Releases
items.description:
This month James and Matt talk about all of the new releases that are out and ready for you to code with in October! There's a new iOS. There has to be a new XCode then too. What would another month be without a new Xamarin.Forms preview release be?

October of Releases by The Xamarin Podcast
items.description_markdown:
This month James and Matt talk about all of the new releases that are out and ready for you to code with in October! There's a new iOS. There has to be a new XCode then too. What would another month be without a new Xamarin.Forms preview release be?

items.title: Indy Xamarin User Group - The Best Way to Architect Your Xamarin.Forms App
items.description:
The title of this talk is a lie. There is no one single way to architect an app. If the app works well, is robust for future expansion, and maintainable - it's architected just fine. You can mess things up though. And then everything is terrible. So, tune in to this talk to find out about some ways you can go about architecting your Xamarin.Forms app so you don't hate yourself before development of the app is complete.

Indy Xamarin User Group - The Best Way to Architect Your Xamarin.Forms App by .NET Foundation
items.description_markdown:
The title of this talk is a lie. There is no one single way to architect an app. If the app works well, is robust for future expansion, and maintainable - it's architected just fine. You can mess things up though. And then everything is terrible. So, tune in to this talk to find out about some ways you can go about architecting your Xamarin.Forms app so you don't hate yourself before development of the app is complete.

[**Indy Xamarin User Group - The Best Way to Architect Your Xamarin.Forms App**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FW_aGvSQ5oQ) by [.NET Foundation](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCiaZbznpWV1o-KLxj8zqR6A)

embedded_links.title: **Indy Xamarin User Group - The Best Way to Architect Your Xamarin.Forms App**

items.title: Xamarin.Essentials 1.6 preview: macOS, media, and more!
items.description:
Xamarin.Essentials has been a staple for developers building iOS, Android, and Windows apps with Xamarin and .NET since it was first released last year. Now, we are introducing Xamarin.Essentials 1.6, which adds new APIs including MediaPicker, AppActions, Contacts, and more.

Xamarin.Essentials 1.6 preview: macOS, media, and more! by James Montemagno
items.description_markdown:
Xamarin.Essentials has been a staple for developers building iOS, Android, and Windows apps with Xamarin and .NET since it was first released last year. Now, we are introducing Xamarin.Essentials 1.6, which adds new APIs including MediaPicker, AppActions, Contacts, and more.

[**Xamarin.Essentials 1.6 preview: macOS, media, and more!**](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/xamarin/xamarin-essentials-1-6-preview/) by [James Montemagno](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/xamarin/author/jamesmontemagno/)
